text:
I love it so much that merely sharing it on Yelp makes me a bit jealous! 

Great variety of tea and wonderfully welcoming environment that even if you are a beginner at tea culture, you won't feel intimidated. Water used is nice; her collection of Taiwanese oolongs and reds (aka black tea) is especially well-worth the price and a breathtakingly beautiful experience. The food is all handmade and delicious; great eclectic take on various foreign and Japanese desserts. 

Note that this is a tiny place (3 tables only with only one good for a group, other two each 2-seats) with quaint atmosphere; it is not good for large groups or if you have highly energetic kids. 

You can also buy loose tea which I do almosr every time I am over.
Delicious, high quality Japanese tea served in a tranquil, quaint environment. Highly recommended!

Stumbled on this micro japanese tea house while strolling in the quiet streets of le plateau. I love discovering hidden gems by flute! 
Very kind and informative host that will explain you all about the Japanese teas. 
It felt like stepping into Japan. Bamboo benches, beautiful and delicate Japanese tea service. 
The tea menu offers a VERY extensive tea list, a bit overwhelming at first but it is best to just ask the host to find out what to get. She will advise you depending on your tastes!
Try the high quality green tea guyoguro.
They are also homemade desserts which I did not try - the matcha cake looked out of this world- will be an excuse to come back!
Special courses and event available...
That's all you need to know!

C'est mon coup de coeur de la semaine. L'endroit est petit et mignon et décoré de petites plantes vertes comme j'aime. La propriétaire est tellement attentioné. Elle a procédé a la cérémonie du thé avec tellement de délicatesse. ÀÀ titre d'accompagnements, j'ai choisi le risotto accompagné d'un thé sucré et en dessert, j'ai choisi le panacotta aux haricots. Autant vous dire que c'est un très bon menu. Ce n'est pas cher non plus, et ce petit coin zen est vraiment sensationnel. Je reviendrai.

Un de mes endroits préférés à Montréal, un petit bijou situé dans une rue calme, tout proche du métro Mont Royal. On a le choix entre beaucoup de thés (surtout des thés verts), des tisanes, et des desserts japonais. Je prends toujours le gâteau au thé vert matcha, qui vient accompagné d'une purée de haricots rouges et d'une mousse à la noix de coco. La propriétaire est adorable. On entend souvent de la musique classique. Il y a des livres sur les estampes japonaises à disposition. C'est un petit salon de thé idéal pour relaxer avec un livre, ou se poser avec des copines.
Awesome neighbourhood place to relax and read a book. They serve high quality Japanese tea and great little deserts/snacks. The owner is very warm and welcoming. I will become a regular.

I joined the event at the tea house today,it was a great experience.we made two difference cake today ,it was fun and can feel that the owner's passion for the tea.we brought what we make today,super!
so zen you authomatically feel relaxed the moment you walk in and ofcourse the tea is excellant..

This is such a great little tea shop! I took my friend on a lady date and we enjoyed our lovely tea flavors with tasty Japanese mochi and matcha cake. The prices are very reasonable and they even sell imported Japanese tea, along with the sweetest teapots and tea accessories. The owner is so sweet and friendly. She prepared our tea for us and was very informative about each type of tea. Definitely coming back here, and I want to recommend this place to everyone :)
5 etoiles pour le confort de l'informalité de la place , un peu en desorde mais service sourriant , agreable, familial, original, vaste choix de thés pour emporter ou boire sur place dans un recoin.
